newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SouthWits jumps on management change talk.
newsitem.headline: SouthWits jumps on management change talk.

text.p: Southern Witwatersrand Exploration Co Ltd jumped to a new two year high in robust volumes on Tuesday and dealers said the share was enjoying speculation about a possible management change.

Randgold and Exporation Co Ltd's announcement on Sunday that its Durban Roodepoort Deep gold mine had agreed in principle to acquire the mineral rights of SouthWits in a deal worth about 55 million rand was also fuelling trade.

SouthWits added six cents to 28 cents by 1037 GMT with more than a million shares changing hands. It is at its highest intraday level since March 6 when it touched 27 cents. Its previous closing high was set on June 12, 1995 when it finished at 24 cents.
"There is a lot of speculation that something is in the offing. It's a speculation, penny stock. Rumour has it that there is a move to get new management in," one dealer said.
"This would be positive. The Durban Deep business is also playing a part. The whole southwest gold field is ripe for speculation," he added.
SouthWits has been climbing strongly since May 15 when it closed at 17 cents but dealers said that the share had a volatile history, spiking up and down regularly.
Durban Deep, however, shed 100 cents to 22.50 rand -- a new year low -- amid very small volume of 2,600 shares.
